Name: Ritter Library
Info: Ritter Library is one of three libraries on campus.

Name: Health Center
Info: Built at the same time as the Lou Higgens Center

Name: Lindsay-Crossman Chapel
Info: Originally called the Emmanuel Methodist Episcopal Church, the church was turned over to BW in the 1950s after a renovation the church was renamed.

Name: Historian's House
Info: House dedicated by the university to hold historical records and artifacts from the university.

Name: Presidents House
Info: The president's house went through renovations in 1982 and 2006. Between 1992 and 2006 president Neil Malicky built a home off campus so the building became the Alumni House which held offices. Currently the house is once again occupied by the president.

Name: Alumni House
Info: The building was formally called Victoria house and used as a residence hall before coming the Alumni House in 2006.

Name: Newman Center
Info: The building is used by the Newman student organization. Newman Centers are Catholic ministry centers at non-Catholic universities found throughout the world.
